meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be removed.
meanings.sent1: The removability of the sticker made it easy to peel off.
meanings.sent2: The removability of the stain from the fabric was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The removability of the clown's red nose caused laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The removability of the obstacle cleared the path for progress.
meanings.sent5: The removability of the bandage revealed the healed wound underneath.

meanings.definition: The ability to be taken away or eliminated.
meanings.sent1: The removability of the old wallpaper allowed for a fresh look in the room.
meanings.sent2: The removability of the virus was crucial for the computer's security.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had a surprising removability during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The removability of doubt from her mind brought clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The removability of the barricade opened up the street for traffic.
